member.name: T:Sp.Agent.SpAgent
member.summary: This portion of the partial class provides a PermutationId-neutral way of being able to access SpAgent.AgentContext from anywhere within the Application. This is used by other code across the NuGet-based Configuration packages as necessary.
This portion of the partial offers as many hints as possible to users and tooling that Equals and ReferenceEquals have no part to play in normal usage of the APIs.

This portion of the partial class implements core functionality to check the correct Initialization of Stores in order to verify that the environmental prerequisites of the Software Potential Components are present and correct.
member.remarks: One should always add a call to SpAgent.Configuration.VerifyStoresInitialized() to your Application environment's Entrypoint.
member.summary: This portion of the partial class implements a static constructor that will ensure the correct initialization of the Agent and Product Contexts [in the correct sequence] implicitly as a side effect of calling methods such as SpAgent.Configuration.VerifyStoresInitialized()
This portion of the partial class allows one to wire in a Product Customization without referring directly to the Product Identity or Permutation Ids.
member.remarks: The default implementation is intended to give an example of how the configuration chain looks like. As-is, it has a null effect - i.e. it just requests default behaviors for almost everything. ([Assuming you haven't added any customizations,] This file and the code within it can actually be deleted as omitting any configuration just defaults all behaviors)

summary.para: This portion of the partial class implements a SpAgent.Configuration.InitializeSharedLicenseStorage() method that should be invoked under the control of an Installer running under Elevated privilege.
See .WithApplicationInitializedStore() for further details.

member.summary: This portion of the partial class customizes the Storage aspect of the Agent Context Configuration to have license data be maintained in a shared storage area that is initialized by the application (under the control of an installer process running Elevated.)
member.remarks: The ConfigureStorageBasePath() and ConfigureStorageRelativePath() partial methods must be implemented to provide the specific path to be used.
member.summary: This portion of the partial class has some helper methods that are used to enable the packages to give earlier warning and/or disambiguated explanations of issues that are likely to crop up at runtime due to the specific values emanating from your Application-specific implementations of ConfigureStorageBasePath() and/or ConfigureStorageRelativePath().
member.remarks: The sanity check methods are intentionally rendered inert in Release builds via a ConditionalAttribute on the basis that you the developer should already have encountered any potential issues during the development process.
member.summary: This portion of the partial class: - exposes two partial methods which are typically implemented in a dependent package (see above for examples). - provides helpers that invoke the extensions (or throw if no such implementation is present)

This portion of the partial class customizes the Storage aspect of the Agent Context Configuration to maintain the license storage in a shared location so that multiple Users on a given Machine can share the access they afford.
By default, this are is under Program Data (e.g. C:\ProgramData\MyCompany\MyProduct\MyVersion)
NB THIS LOCATION MUST BE CREATED AND INITIALIZED BY AN INSTALLER RUNNING ELEVATED PRIOR TO RUNNING YOUR APPLICATION ON A GIVEN MACHINE.
member.remarks:
See SoftwarePotential.Configuration.Local.SingleUser if you need to address this restriction [by using the user profile and accepting the restriction that licenses cannot be used across multiple user profiles on a given machine].
The ConfigureStorageBasePath() and ConfigureStorageRelativePath() partial methods must both be implemented to together provide the specific path to be used.
member.summary: This portion of the partial class plugs into the ConfigureDistributor extension point of the SoftwarePotential.Configuration Package and in turn provides a (mandatory) ConfigureStaticDistributorDiscovery extension point.

This portion of the partial class uses the Storage configured via the SoftwarePotential.Configuration.(Multi|Single)User Package's ConfigureStorage() implementation to maintain a setting within an area that the Application will be able to write to regardless of which user is active.
member.remarks: see https://support.softwarepotential.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001365849--SingleUser-Configuration-README or https://support.softwarepotential.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001380105-Multi-User-Configuration-README for further information about Sp.Agent's storage mechanisms

member.name: M:Sp.Agent.SpAgent.Configuration.VerifyStoresInitialized
member.summary:
Should be called once from Main/your entrypoint before running any Licensed or Protected code or calling Licensing APIs (e.g. Activation)
Ideally the work involved in this should take place on a background thread in parallel with other initialization activities.
NB depending on the store type involved, it may be necessary to call SpAgent.Configuration.InitializeSharedLicenseStorage() or similar as part of one's installation sequence.
member.remarks: NB Calling the method has the important side effect of Initializing the configurations (see static constructor below)

member.name: P:Sp.Agent.SpAgent.Configuration.StoresInitialization
member.remarks: NB Calling the method has the critical side effect of Initializing the Agent Context and Product Context configurations [via the static constructor of SpAgent]

summary.para: Configure the shared license storage - NB needs to run Elevated, i.e. via an Administrator Command Prompt or an Installer.
NB You should not call SpAgent.Configuration.VerifyStoresInitialized() before this method.
NB Your installer needs to ensure this gets called based on one of the following outline approaches:

para.para: APPROACH A: USE MANAGED INSTALLER CLASS AND INVOKE IT (ELEVATED) FROM YOUR INSTALLATION TOOL/SCRIPT
There is a standard .NET Managed Installer class called SpAgentInstaller in SpAgent.Local.MultiUser.Installer.cs which will call SpAgentConfiguration.InitializeSharedLicenseStorage().
Have your Installer / installation batch file run the Managed Installer by either
1. Configuring it to run Managed Installers in this Assembly.
(Installer products (e.g. InstallShield) have built in menu options to run managed installers.)

2. Invoking INSTALLUTIL.EXE from within your Installer /installation batch file e.g.
{Microsoft.NET folder}\installutil.exe {this Assembly path.exe}
APPROACH B: ADD AN INSTALLATION COMMANDLINE OPTION AND CALL IT (ELEVATED) FROM YOUR INSTALLATION TOOL/SCRIPT
1. Add a commandline option to your Application's Main()/entry point (i.e., call SpAgent.CommandLineProcessing.ProcessInstallationArgs(args)) that will, when the commandline option is supplied:
b. exit to allow the rest of the installation to complete (i.e. the application should exit immediately)
2. Make the Installer / installation batch file trigger it once as the app is being deployed/installed
AT DEVELOPMENT TIME (ONLY) (IF YOU RUN VISUAL STUDIO ELEVATED), you could set up a post build step to perform this initialization (i.e. set the Post Build Event Command line as:

remarks.para: NB the 'StoreInitialization' portion of the code triggers a call to AgentConfiguration.Configure which should not be removed.

Your Internal Product Definition name.
Your Internal Product Definition version.

summary.para: Composes a complete path to a license store directory from invocations of ConfigureStorageBasePath() and ConfigureStorageRelativePath() (see ConfiguredBaseAndRelativePathElements() for details).

Typically, this is useful when such a location is created and permissioned externally such as during application deployment (i.e. by an installer) or by the Application Hosting Environment (e.g., ASP.NET's App_Data).

member.name: M:Sp.Agent.SpAgent.ConfiguredBaseAndRelativePathElements
member.summary:
Returns a license store location consisting of 2 parts:
base path - license store root path, which can be shared between applications
relative path - when combined with base path, yields a combined result that is unique per application. See ConfigureStorageBasePath() and ConfigureStorageRelativePath() for details of the relevant extensibility points.

member.name: M:Sp.Agent.SpAgent.ConfigureStorageBasePath(System.Action{System.String})
member.summary:
Must be implemented to provide a path to the base directory within which the Licensing System is to maintain its licenses.
The default implementation uses a standard Windows Shared Data area, which typically results in a path like C:\ProgramData. When combined with the result from ConfigureStorageRelativePath(), this yields a path which can be shared across users yet be isolated to your Application.
See the documentation for WithApplicationInitializedStore() in Sp.Agent.Local and MultiUserStorageStrategy for further detail.
member.param: delegate that must be invoked to accept the configured value.

member.name: M:Sp.Agent.SpAgent.ConfigureStorageRelativePath(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Action{System.String})
member.summary:
Must be implemented to provide a subdirectory layout to be used within the shared area supplied via ConfigureStorageBasePath().
The default implementation uses your Software Potential Vendor and Product name strings to provide a unique subfolder path.
When combined with the result from ConfigureStorageBasePath(), this typically results in a path such as: C:\ProgramData\MyCompany\MyProduct\MyVersion.
See the documentation for WithApplicationInitializedStore() in Sp.Agent.Local and MultiUserStorageStrategy for further detail.
member.param: delegate that must be invoked to accept the configured value.
The vendor name as specified in your Software Potential account registration.
The product name as specified in your Software Potential product definition.
The product version as specified in your Software Potential product definition.

member.name: T:Sp.Agent.MultiUserStorageStrategy
member.summary: Manages the storage of files in a location within the OS appropriate shared program data folder. On Windows this is ProgramData On Linux based OS' this is /usr/share/ On OSX this is /Library/Application Support/
member.remarks: Default permissioning of these folders is such that data maintained within the area is owned by CREATOR OWNER. As license upgrades etc. may take place in the context of a different Windows User Profile, we need to ensure that the folder is appropriately reconfigured such that other users can rewrite or delete licenses as necessary.

member.name: P:Sp.Agent.MultiUserStorageStrategy.ProgramDataFolderPath
member.summary: Obtains the ProgramData path for this machine / OS.
member.value: On windows same as %ProgramData%, e.g., C:\ProgramData. Mac returns /Library/Application Support/. Linux returns /usr/share/

member.remarks: Typically this algorithm does not require customization as it as proven to work correctly across a variety of target deployment platforms.
member.param: The directory to be prepared.

member.summary: Represents a collection of Attributes attached to a ProjectObject. Attributes are stored as a key/value pair. Keys can be assoicated with a Guid. A key with a Guid can only be removed by a client that knows the Guid.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates the PowerPac and updates RobotStudios internal state about which PowerPac is active. This method is typically called by RobotStudio, but might also be called by the PowerPac.
member.remarks: If the PowerPac is not already deactivated, OnDeactivate is called.
member.returns: True if OnDeactivate returns true or already deactivated. False if OnDeactivate returns false.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.OnActivate
member.summary: Called when the user has told RobotStudio to activate your PowerPac.
member.returns: True if you have activated the PowerPac, false if you could not activate.
member.remarks: Add the user interface elements needed for the PowerPac.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.OnDeactivate
member.summary: Called when the user has told RobotStudio to deactivate your PowerPac.
member.returns: True if you have deactivated the PowerPac, false if not. For example you might want to prevent deactivation if there is unsaved data.
member.remarks: Remove or hide(?) the user interface elements added in OnActivate. RobotStudio will make visible all its RibbonTabs automatically.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.CanActivate(System.String@)
member.summary: Called by RobotStudio user interface code, to let you tell the user if your PowerPac can be activated or not.
member.param: If you return false, then specify a reason using this paramter.
member.returns: True if the PowerPac can be activated, false if not.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.CanDeactivate(System.String@)
member.summary: Called by RobotStudio user interface code, to let you tell the user if your PowerPac can be deactivated or not.
member.param: If you return false, then specify a reason using this paramter.
member.returns: True if the PowerPac can be activated, false if not.
member.remarks: The default implementation always returns true, which should be sufficient for most PowerPacs. This method will be called frequently. Only return false if your in the middle of along running operation that cannot easily be interrupted.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.HostedAddInBase.OnLoad
member.summary: Called when the PowerPac DLL is first loaded into memory by RobotStudio.
member.remarks: Override this method only if you need to do initialization code that should only be called once in the life time of the PowerPac. Do not add user interface here.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Robotstudio_7X.Features.LicensedFeatureAttribute

summary.para: Marks a method to be replaced with Protected code by the Software Potential Code Protector during the build process.
Typically one should use the specific Feature attributes in this Features class in preference to using this directly.
Updating the NuGet package associated with this file will pick up new Features.

member.remarks: This class fulfills two key requirements in order to be identified by the Software Potential Code Protector versions >= 3.2.1942 as a Protection Attribute just as Slps.ProtectionAttributes.FeatureAttribute is: - class name is LicensedFeatureAttribute (even after Obfuscation) - bears a read/write property called FeatureName which has a value matching that in the Software Potential Product Definition (even after Obfuscation)

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Robotstudio_7X.LicenseAttribute
member.summary: Require any License for 'RobotStudio' - '7.x' to be present.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Options
member.summary: Provides static methods, properties and events to store and read user options. Options are grouped in sections.
member.remarks: Options created by Add-Ins shall use a section name that is unique for the Add-In, to avoid conflicts between Add-Ins. If the Add-In has a lot of options and you would like to group them into different sections, then use the same prefix for each section name. For example "CompanyABCAddIn.SectionA", "CompanyABCAddIn.SectionB" etc.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.ProjectSelection
member.summary: Represents a collection of all selected objects. Selection is a concept used from the user interface. Typically it is used to specify for which objects to perform an action, to view information for specific objects and to show which operations that are availble for specific objects. The most common way for a user to select an object is to click with the mouse in the graphic view or in a browser. Using this object you can programatically control which objects that are selected and get notified when selection has changed.

member.summary: Occurs before an undo operation.

member.summary: Clears the Undo and Redo queues.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.Undo
member.summary: Undoes the operations made during the last undo step.
member.remarks: It is not legal to call this method while inside an undo step.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.Redo
member.summary: Redoes the changes undone by the last call to Undo()
member.remarks: It is not legal to call this method while inside an undo step.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.BeginUndoStep
member.summary: Starts a new unnamed undo step.
member.remarks: It is not recommended to make unnamed undo steps. Use BeginUndoStep(string name) instead.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.BeginUndoStep(System.String)
member.summary: Begins a new undo step.
member.param: The name of the undo step.
member.remarks: The name should be localized, since it will be displayed in the user interface.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.AppendToUndoStep(System.String)
member.summary: Similar to , but tries to append changes to the previous undo step, instead of creating a new one.
member.remarks: The name must match the name of the previous undo step. Otherwise a new undo step one will be created.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.AppendToUndoStep(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Similar to , but tries to append changes to the previous undo step, instead of creating a new one.
member.param: Name of undo step, if a new one is created.
If true, changes are appended to the previous undostep (if one exists) even if the names do not match.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.EndUndoStep
member.summary: Ends the current undo step.
member.remarks: It is legal to make nested calls to Begin/EndUndoStep(). Only the outermost EndUndoStep() call will actually close the undo step.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.CancelUndoStep(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.CancelUndoStepType)
member.summary: Marks the current undo step as canceled.
member.remarks: When the canceled undo step is closed by EndUndoStep(), either all changes will be undone ("rollback"), or the undo/redo queues will be cleared, depending on the value of 'cancelType'.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ExecuteUndoStep(System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Creates an undo step and executes the code in the passed in delegate inside it.
member.remarks: In case of an exception, the undo step will be rolled back and the error will be logged to the RobotStudio output window.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ExecuteUndoStep(System.String,System.Action,System.Action{System.Exception})
member.summary: Creates an undo step and executes the code in the passed in delegate inside it.
member.remarks: In case of an exception, the passed in errorHandler delegate will be executed.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ExecuteAppendUndoStep(System.String,System.Action)
member.summary: Creates or appends to an undo step and executes the code in the passed in delegate inside it.
member.remarks: The name must match the name of the previous undo step. Otherwise a new undo step one will be created. In case of an exception, the undo step will be rolled back and the error will be logged to the RobotStudio output window.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false if an exception was thrown.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.GetUndoNames
member.summary: Returns an array of the names of all undo steps in the undo queue

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.GetRedoNames
member.summary: Returns an array of the names of all redo steps in the redo queue

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.AddChange(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.IChange)
member.summary: Adds an undoable operation (see ).
member.remarks: If an undo step is not currently open, the change will be added to the previous undo step.

member.summary: Temporarily disables collection of undoable changes.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.UndoContext.ResumeUndoStep
member.summary: Resumes collection of undoable changes.

member.summary: Represents a single UNDO step

member.summary: Adds a change to an open delta state

member.summary: Returns a list of all changes in the delta state

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Redo
member.summary: Redoes a previously undone delta state.
member.remarks:
Pre-condition: CanRedo() == true CanUndo() == false
Post-condition: CanRedo() == false CanUndo() == (true or false)

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Undo
member.summary: Undoes a delta state.
member.remarks:
Pre-condition: CanRedo() == false CanUndo() == true
Post-condition: CanRedo() == (true or false) CanUndo() == false

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Close
member.summary: Closes the delta state
member.remarks: No more changes should be added after this call. Will in turn call OnCloseDeltaState() in all changes.

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoDeltaState.Reopen
member.summary: Reopens a closed deltastate so that more changes can be appended to it.

member.summary: Returns the numeric id of the current (or last, if no current) deltastate

member.summary: Clears the UNDO and REDO queues

member.summary: Clears the REDO queue

member.summary: Clears the UNDO queue

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.Redo
member.summary: Redoes a previously undone delta state

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.Undo
member.summary: Undoes the last delta state

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.BeginDeltaState(System.String)
member.summary: Starts a new delta state
member.remarks: It is legal to call this method when a delta state is already open. The number of calls to BeginDeltaState() and EndDeltaState() must match, however.

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.AppendDeltaState(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tries to "reopen" the last delta state, appending changes to it
member.remarks: If a description is not null, it must match the name of the previous deltastate, otherwise a new deltastate will be created. If there is no previous deltastate, a new one will be created (and aborted, so the queue will be empty after it has been closed)

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.EndDeltaState
member.summary: Ends the current delta state
member.remarks: There should be exacly the same number of calls to BeginDeltaState() and EndDeltaState().

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.AbortDeltaState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Aborts the current delta state
member.param: true if the queues should be cleared when the delta state is closed
member.remarks: This call just sets an abort flag; EndDeltaState() must still be called to actually close the delta state. After the delta state is closed, it will be rolled back(undone).

member.name: M:RobotStudio.API.Core.UndoManager.AddChange(RobotStudio.API.Core.IUndoChange)
member.summary: Adds a change to the current delta state
member.remarks: If there is no current delta state, the system will add it to the previous delta state, or otherwise throw it away.

member.summary: Deletes a delta state
